dt: {bc}a journey or excursion undertaken for a specific purpose
{bc}the group of persons making such a journey

pt: {sc}haste{/sc} {sc}hurry{/sc} {sc}speed{/sc} {sc}expedition{/sc} {sc}dispatch{/sc} mean quickness in movement or action. {sc}haste{/sc} applies to personal action and implies urgency and precipitancy and often rashness.
{sc}hurry{/sc} often has a strong suggestion of agitated bustle or confusion.

pt.t: in the {it}hurry{/it} of departure she forgot her toothbrush

pt: {sc}speed{/sc} suggests swift efficiency in movement or action.

{sc}expedition{/sc} and {sc}dispatch{/sc} both imply speed and efficiency in handling affairs but {sc}expedition{/sc} stresses ease or efficiency of performance and {sc}dispatch{/sc} stresses promptness in concluding matters.

pt.t: the case came to trial with {it}expedition{/it}

shortdef: a journey or excursion undertaken for a specific purpose
the group of persons making such a journey

dt: {bc}a legal interrogation or examination to discover information for a later proceeding
{bc}an investigation that does not stick to a stated objective but hopes to uncover incriminating or newsworthy evidence

shortdef: a legal interrogation or examination to discover information for a later proceeding
an investigation that does not stick to a stated objective but hopes to uncover incriminating or newsworthy evidence
